title: Pillow Cover, 1600–1650
medium:
Medium: linen foundation, silk, metallic thread, mica, glass chips and beads, pearls
Technique: silk embroidered on plain weave using tent stitch and tent stitch with cut loops over padding; metal thread embroidery using slanted running stitch with diagon
description: Small cushion with a design showing a woman in the center with short brown hair and a blue and white gown worked in chenille thread. She holds in her right hand a scroll with the inscription: "Faith." She is surrounded by oversized flower sprays. At lower right is a pool with a bird, and at left, a leopard. Above is a castle with mica windows. Background is worked in silver thread and sides edged with silver lace.

tombstone.epitaph:
Pillow Cover, 1600–1650.Medium: linen foundation, silk, metallic thread, mica, glass chips and beads, pearls
Technique: silk embroidered on plain weave using tent stitch and tent stitch with cut loops over padding; metal thread embroidery using slanted running stitch with diagon. 1959-170-2.
